Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band (mostly worn) at rim, glazed below; part of lotus-palmette in added white outline with added red centres; exterior: Z band at rim between dilute lines; below, pendant lozenge as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The exterior and interior surfaces of the sherd were burnt during the bombings in London in 1941. 'UCL n.p.61' inked on rim.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1590) (phase 2)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: ucl np 61 (Other Accession Number)
